Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the definition of victim of domestic violence to include economic abuse
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Expanding the definition of victim of domestic violence to include economic abuse.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing February 21 as Mother Language Day in the City of New York to honor the importance of the Bengali/Bangla language to Bangladeshis everywhere and to promote the acceptance of linguistic and cultural diversity in our communities
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing February 21 as Mother Language Day in the City of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to establish Diwali as an official holiday for New York City public school students
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Establish Diwali as an official holiday for  NYC public school students.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to estimating the annual expenditures required to provide legal services for tenants who are subject to eviction proceedings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Estimating the annual expenditures required to provide legal services for tenants who are subject to eviction proceedings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State legislature to introduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would require the New York State Office of Court Administration to manage the housing docket to set an upper limit on how many housing cases can be placed on a calendar per month, such that all tenants eligible for a right to counsel attorney are able to be offered representation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: NYS Office of Court Administration to manage the housing docket to set an upper limit on how many housing cases can be placed on a calendar per month, such that all tenants eligible for a right to counsel attorney are able to be offered representation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notification of the removal of parking spaces
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Notification of the removal of parking spaces.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the department of transportation to study street design as a means to limit or reduce the use by commercial vehicles of streets in residential neighborhoods
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of transportation to study street design as a means to limit or reduce the use by commercial vehicles of streets in residential neighborhoods.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conducting a  study of the impact that truck and delivery traffic generated by last mile facilities have on local communities and infrastructure
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Conducting a  study of the impact that truck and delivery traffic generated by last mile facilities have on local communities and infrastructure.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on top maritime importers to New York City ports to commit to making the City’s streets greener by reducing truck traffic and using marine vessels for last mile deliveries throughout the boroughs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Top maritime importers to New York City ports to commit to making the City’s streets greener by reducing truck traffic and using marine vessels for last mile deliveries throughout the boroughs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to create the New York State Working Families Tax Credit.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Create the New York State Working Families Tax Credit.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that allows for the conversion of commercial units to residential units and creates the Affordable Housing from Commercial Conversions (AHCC) tax benefit program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Allows for the conversion of commercial units to residential units and creates the Affordable Housing from Commercial Conversions (AHCC) tax benefit program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, the administrative code of the city of New York, the New York city plumbing code, and the New York city building code, in relation to the terms “inmate,” “prisoner,” and “incarcerated individual” and other similar terminology as used therein
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: NYC plumbing code, and the NYC building code, in relation to the terms “inmate,” “prisoner,” and “incarcerated individual” and other similar terminology as used therein.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to conduct an annual study on bicycle activity
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of transportation to conduct an annual study on bicycle activity.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing a task force to study the feasibility of building charging stations for bicycles with electric assist to be used by food delivery workers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Establishing a task force to study the feasibility of building charging stations for bicycles with electric assist to be used by food delivery workers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report on funding for restorative justice programming and services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report on funding for restorative justice programming and services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting discrimination on the basis of poverty in opportunities of employment and access to public accommodations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting discrimination on the basis of poverty in opportunities of employment and access to public accommodations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to reintroduce and pass and the President to sign the Cannabis Administration and Opportunity Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Cannabis Administration and Opportunity Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring distribution of information regarding phone interpretation services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring distribution of information regarding phone interpretation services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Design and Construction and the New York City Department of Correction to repurpose and convert the Manhattan Detention Complex into the new Borough Based Jail in lieu of demolition.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: NYC Department of Design and Construction and the NYC Department of Correction to repurpose and convert the Manhattan Detention Complex into the new Borough Based Jail in lieu of demolition.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to clarifying the health code where approvals from multiple agencies are required
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Clarifying the health code where approvals from multiple agencies are required.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a commercial waste zones working group
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Creating a commercial waste zones working group.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a study on the feasibility of establishing a social housing agency and the repeal of this local law upon the expiration thereof
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: A study on the feasibility of establishing a social housing agency and the repeal of this local law upon the expiration thereof.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.5573/S.3082, in relation to prohibiting eviction without good cause.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting eviction without good cause. (A.5573/S.3082)

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing a task force to examine disparities in contracting
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Establishing a task force to examine disparities in contracting.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.322/A.7454, the Chisholm Chance Act, which would establish a plan to address the severe maternal morbidity crisis in Brooklyn and the Bronx.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Chisholm Chance Act (S.322/A.7454)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of housing preservation and development to submit reports on veteran preference in Mitchell-Lama developments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of housing preservation and development to submit reports on veteran preference in Mitchell-Lama developments.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Powers) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, March 2, 2023.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 470-A,  VOTE: 42-7-0
Negative: Council Members Ariola, Carr, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).
Present, Not Voting: Council Member Mealy.

Int. No. 897,  VOTE: 47-0-2
Abstentions: Council Members Vernikov and Yeger.
Present, Not Voting: Council Member Mealy.

Preconsidered Res. No. 502, VOTE: 42-6-1
Negative: Council Members Ariola, Carr, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).
Abstention: Council Member Yeger.
Present, Not Voting: Council Member Mealy.

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
